meanings.definition: A type of ancient dwelling built on an artificial island in a lake.
meanings.sent1: The crannoge stood proudly on the small island in the lake.
meanings.sent2: People used to live in the crannoge surrounded by water.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to admire the crannoge as if it were their own tiny castle.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination turned the crannoge into a magical floating palace.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the crannoge felt like stepping back in time to a mysterious world.

meanings.definition: To construct or live in a crannoge.
meanings.sent1: They decided to crannoge a new home on the lake's island.
meanings.sent2: The family planned to crannoge on the secluded island for a year.
meanings.sent3: It would be quite an adventure to crannoge on a tiny island!
meanings.sent4: Their determination to crannoge a unique dwelling was inspiring.
meanings.sent5: Crannoging a house on the water required skill and patience.

meanings.definition: The act of studying or researching crannoges.
meanings.sent1: Her passion for crannogeology led her to explore ancient lake dwellings.
meanings.sent2: The university offered a course in crannogeology for history enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The professor's excitement about crannogeology was contagious.
meanings.sent4: In the library, she delved into the fascinating world of crannogeology.
meanings.sent5: Crannogeology opened up a whole new realm of discovery for the students.
